title: Executive Order 8595-Amendment of Executive Order No. 8502 of August 3, 1940, Prescribing Regulations Governing the Grades and Ratings of Enlisted Men of the Regular Army for the Fiscal Year 1941
content: By virtue of and pursuant to the authority vested in me by the Act of June 20, 1936, 49 Stat. 1554, Executive Order No. 8502 of August 3, 1940, prescribing regulations governing the grades and ratings of enlisted men of the Regular Army for the fiscal year 1941, is hereby amended so that, effective November 18, 1940 and during the remainder of the fiscal year 1941, the grades and ratings of the enlisted men of the Regular Army shall be as set forth herein and the number of enlisted men in the several grades and ratings, including selective-service trainees assigned to Regular Army units, shall not exceed the number specified herein:
1. The several grades and the maximum number of enlisted men therein shall be as follows:
2. Specialists rating and the maximum number of enlisted men therein shall be as follows:
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 8595-Amendment of Executive Order No. 8502 of August 3, 1940, Prescribing Regulations Governing the Grades and Ratings of Enlisted Men of the Regular Army for the Fiscal Year 1941 Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/368494
